page.title: 03Resident of Old Tockwith.
page.content: {Mr.K.Gosley}owns an {Agricultural {Engineering}business in Tockwith. His family moved here in 1929 when his father bought the business. It was originally a {Blacksmith's.}Mr Gosley left the village school at the age of 14 to work in the family business. His father taught him the trade. As farming changed, with tractors superceding shire horses, so the business had to change. New skills had to be learned. These include repairing and manufacturing farm machinery. The premises are a fascinating mixture of old and new. The old forge and anvils, where the horse shoes were made, remain. In contrast, a modern lathe is ready to shape metals. Mr Gosley married a local girl. They have a son,{Donald,}who works in the family business, and lives in Tockwith.
